oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Influence of particle arrangement on coarsening during sintering of three spherical particles
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: WAKAI, F
YOSHIDA, M
KASHYAP, BP
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: different sizes
diffusion
coalescence
simulation
growth
model
sintering
coarsening
grain growth
simulation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three-dimensional numerical simulation was performed to show that coarsening and grain growth was affected by particle arrangement in sintering of identical spheres. In the sintering of a row of three spheres the center particle with the coordination number of 2 coarsened, while particles on both sides with coordination number of I shrank and disappeared. The particles on both sides disappeared in a shorter time with increasing ratio of grain boundary energy gamma(gb) to surface energy gamma(s). A new bond between two particles on both sides was created during sintering of three spheres with bond angle of 70 degrees. This particle rearrangement changed the coordination number, and retarded the coarsening.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF THE CERAMIC SOCIETY OF JAPAN, 114(1335), 974-978
